material-property-value-condition.content: You are a knowledgeable assistant specialized in recognizing and understanding named entities and their interrelations. When requested to organize information in tabular format, you are adept at filtering and presenting only the relevant and valid results. You will exclude any results that are not pertinent or are inaccurate from the table according to the discussion history.

Please analyze the following paragraph and summarize the properties, including their numerical values, of the mentioned materials.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Material Name', 'Material Property', 'Material Property (Abbr.)', 'Numerical Value', 'Condition']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage (V OC) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current (J SC) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor (FF) of 47.5 % and a power conversion efficiency (PCE) of 1.6 % . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8 % , respectively . In terms of PCE , approximately 56 % was improved with 2.5 % , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor . Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400 - 500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3 - hexylthiophene) , P3HT (V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V) . This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB (-5.53 eV) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT (-4.9 eV) . 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB (FF = 55.8 %) increased by 39 % compared to PCZDTB (FF = 40.1 %) . The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively . In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively . The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB . The decrease of series resistance could increase FF . PQCDTB showed high FF than PCZDTB due to decrease of series resistance by self - organization of quinacridone unit . 9 Figure 5b showed the external quantum efficiency (EQE) data of the fabricated device . When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38 % and 41 % EQE at 480 nm , respectively . The photovoltaic devices with PC71BM as an acceptor showed higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor , although they absorbed photons in the same range of the solar spectra . This was because PC71BM has a stronger UV - vis absorption property than does PC61BM in the visible region , especially near 500 nm . 30 Hence , the PCE improved with an increase in J SC . In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48 % was observed at 440 nm . Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π - π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB .

Let's think step by step.

Step 1: Identify the materials mentioned in the paragraph.

- PQCDTB
- PC61BM
- PC71BM
- P3HT
- PCZDTB

Step 2: Identify the properties mentioned in the paragraph.

- Open-circuit voltage (VOC)
- Short-circuit current (JSC)
- Fill factor (FF)
- Power conversion efficiency (PCE)
- Series resistance
- External quantum efficiency (EQE)
- λ max (wavelength at maximum absorption)

Step 3: Identify the numerical values associated with each property.

- PQCDTB and PC61BM (1:1 ratio):
  - VOC: 0.76 V
  - JSC: 4.4 mA cm^-2
  - FF: 47.5%
  - PCE: 1.6%

- PQCDTB and PC71BM (1:1 ratio):
  - VOC: 0.79 V
  - JSC: 5.6 mA cm^-2
  - FF: 55.8%

- PQCDTB (compared to P3HT):
  - VOC: PQCDTB > P3HT (0.5-0.6 V)

- PQCDTB (compared to PCZDTB):
  - FF: PQCDTB (55.8%) > PCZDTB (40.1%)

- Series resistance:
  - PQCDTB and PC71BM (1:1 ratio): 31 Ω/cm^2
  - PQCDTB and PC71BM (1:2 ratio): 27 Ω/cm^2
  - PCZDTB and PC71BM (1:1 ratio): 320 Ω/cm^2
  - PCZDTB and PC71BM (1:4 ratio): 62 Ω/cm^2

- EQE:
  - PQCDTB and PC61BM: 38% at 480 nm
  - PQCDTB and PC71BM: 41% at 480 nm
  - PCZDTB: 48% at 440 nm

- λ max:
  - PCZDTB: blue-shifted by -30 nm compared to PQCDTB

Step 4: Identify the conditions mentioned in the paragraph.

- PC71BM has greater photon absorption at 400-500 nm compared to PC61BM.
- PC71BM has stronger UV-vis absorption property than PC61BM in the visible region, especially near 500 nm.
- PQCDTB has a lower HOMO level than P3HT (-5.53 eV vs. -4.9 eV).
- The decrease in series resistance could increase FF.
- PQCDTB showed higher FF than PCZDTB due to the self-organization of the quinacridone unit.

Based on the above analysis, the valid relationships can be presented in a Markdown table as follows:

|---------------|----------------------------|---------------------------|-----------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|

| PQCDTB        | JSC                        | J_SC                      | 4.4 mA cm^-2    |                                                                           |
| PQCDTB        | FF                         | FF                        | 47.5%           |                                                                           |
| PQCDTB        | PCE                        | PCE                       | 1.6%            |                                                                           |
| PQCDTB        | VOC                        | V_OC                      | 0.79 V          | Blended with PC71BM in a 1:1 ratio                                       |
| PQCDTB        | JSC                        | J_SC                      | 5.6 mA cm^-2    | Blended with PC
